title: 1972) and for the purposes of giving effect to Regulation (EU) 2019/1239 of the
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Maritime
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Maritime 

Reporting Obligations) Regulations 2025. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 15 August 2025.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited european union (maritime reporting obligations) regulation 2025 (2) regulation come operation 15 august 2025

title: 1972) and for the purposes of giving effect to Regulation (EU) 2019/1239 of the
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations – 

“EU Regulation” means Regulation (EU) 2019/1239 of the European Parliament 
and of the Council of 20 June 2019 establishing a European Maritime Single 
Window environment and repealing Directive 2010/65/EU1; 

“FAL documents” means the forms and declarations listed in Part B of the Annex 
to the EU Regulation; 

“Marine Survey Office” means that part of the Department of Transport that is 
commonly known by that name; 

“port” means a place or a geological area designed principally to permit the 
reception of ships and includes - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

a harbour (within the meaning of the Harbours Act 1996 (No. 11 
of 1996)), 

a fishery harbour centre (within the meaning of the Fishery 
Harbour Centres Act 1968 (No. 18 of 1968)), 

a harbour transferred to a relevant local authority under section 
88(2) of the Harbours Act 1996, 

a customs port (within the meaning of the Customs Act 2015 (No. 
18 of 2015)), 

(e) Rosslare Europort, and 

(f) Greenore Port; 

“SafeSeasIreland” means the maritime information exchange system established 
by the Minister for Transport pursuant to Article 22a of Directive 2002/59/EC 
of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 June 20022. 

1 OJ No. L 198, 25.07.2019, p.64. 
2 OJ No. L 208, 05.08.2022, p.10. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 15th August, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [395] 3 

(2) A word or expression used in these Regulations and which is also used 
in the EU Regulation has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same 
meaning in these Regulations as it has in the EU Regulation.

title: 1972) and for the purposes of giving effect to Regulation (EU) 2019/1239 of the
heading: 3. These Regulations apply to ships arriving at, staying in and departing
text_raw:
3. These Regulations apply to ships arriving at, staying in and departing 

from a port in the State.
text_norm: 3 regulation apply ship arriving staying departing port state

title: 1972) and for the purposes of giving effect to Regulation (EU) 2019/1239 of the
heading: 4. The Marine Survey Office is designated as –
text_raw:
4. The Marine Survey Office is designated as – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the competent authority in the State for the purposes of the EU 
Regulation, 

the national authority for the purposes of Article 12(2) of the EU 
Regulation, and 

the national coordinator for the purposes of Article 18 of the EU 
Regulation.
text_norm: 4 marine survey office designated - (a) (b) (c) competent authority state purpose eu regulation national authority purpose article 12(2) eu regulation national coordinator purpose article 18 eu regulation

title: 1972) and for the purposes of giving effect to Regulation (EU) 2019/1239 of the
heading: 5. (1) SafeSeasIreland is the maritime National Single Window for the
text_raw:
5. (1) SafeSeasIreland is the maritime National Single Window for the 

purposes of the EU Regulation. 

(2) A declarant shall provide the information required pursuant to - 

(a) 

the legal acts listed at points 1, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 9 of Part A of the 
Annex to the EU Regulation, and 

(b) 

the FAL documents, 

to the Marine Survey Office using SafeSeasIreland. 

(3) In the event of a temporary failure of SafeSeasIreland, a declarant shall 
provide the information referred to in paragraph (2), by email or other electronic 
means, as specified on a website maintained by or on behalf of the Marine 
Survey Office.
text_norm: 5 (1) safeseasireland maritime national single window purpose eu regulation (2) declarant shall provide information required pursuant - (a) legal act listed point 1 3 4 5 6 9 part annex eu regulation (b) fal document marine survey office using safeseasireland (3) event temporary failure safeseasireland declarant shall provide information referred paragraph (2) email electronic mean specified website maintained behalf marine survey office

title: 1972) and for the purposes of giving effect to Regulation (EU) 2019/1239 of the
heading: 6. (1) A declarant shall provide, prior to the arrival of a ship in a port, the
text_raw:
6. (1) A declarant shall provide, prior to the arrival of a ship in a port, the 

information required pursuant to the FAL documents - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

at least 24 hours prior to the arrival of the ship in a port, 

if the voyage time is less than 24 hours, before the ship leaves the 
previous port, or 

if the port of call is not known or it is changed during the voyage, 
as soon as the information is available. 

(2) A declarant shall provide, at the latest upon departure of a ship from a 

port, the information required pursuant to the FAL documents.
text_norm: 6 (1) declarant shall provide prior arrival ship port information required pursuant fal document - (a) (b) (c) least 24 hour prior arrival ship port voyage time le 24 hour ship leaf previous port port call known changed voyage soon information available (2) declarant shall provide latest upon departure ship port information required pursuant fal document

title: 1972) and for the purposes of giving effect to Regulation (EU) 2019/1239 of the
heading: 7. The European Union (Reporting Formalities for Ships) Regulations 2012
text_raw:
7. The European Union (Reporting Formalities for Ships) Regulations 2012 

(S.I. No. 166 of 2012) are revoked. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [395] 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

13 August, 2025. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 
Minister for Transport.

title: 1972) and for the purposes of giving effect to Regulation (EU) 2019/1239 of the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations give effect to EU Regulation 2019/1239 and continue to 
designate SafeSeasIreland as the national single window for the purposes of 
maritime reporting obligations. The Regulations also designate the Marine 
Survey Office of the Department of Transport as the competent authority for the 
purposes of the Regulations. The Regulations revoke the European Union 
(Reporting Formalities for Ships) Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 166 of 2012). 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [395]
